threat_description: Adversaries may exploit system vulnerabilities, overwhelm resources, or manipulate system behavior to impair the availability of critical government services such as infrastructure, elections, and emergency response. This threat targets the continuity of operations, public safety, and trust in governance.

motives.motive: Impair government functionality and public safety

components.name: Critical Infrastructure Systems
components.description: Systems managing essential services such as power grids, water supply, and transportation networks vital to government operations and public welfare.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unrestricted resource usage on backend servers could be exploited via DoS attacks, disrupting critical infrastructure services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-770: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of resource limits on backend servers could allow attackers to overwhelm infrastructure systems, impairing service delivery.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of authentication could allow attackers to disrupt infrastructure controls, affecting public safety.
Weak authentication could be bypassed, enabling unauthorized interference with infrastructure operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted transmission of control data could be intercepted and disrupted, affecting infrastructure functionality.
Failure to validate certificates could enable spoofing, disrupting communication within infrastructure systems.

components.name: Electoral Systems
components.description: Systems supporting voter registration, ballot casting, and election result tabulation, critical to democratic processes.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Uncontrolled resource usage in backend technologies could be exploited to disrupt voting systems, undermining electoral integrity.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-730: Denial of Service via Algorithmic Complexity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exploiting inefficient algorithms in backend technologies could cause delays or crashes in electoral systems.
Inadequate access controls could allow unauthorized disruption of electoral processes, affecting public trust.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Misconfigured permissions could enable attackers to impair electoral system functionality.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unverified software updates could introduce malicious code, disrupting electoral system operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorporating untrusted code could compromise electoral systems, leading to service disruptions.

components.name: Emergency Response Systems
components.description: Systems coordinating disaster response, law enforcement, and medical services during emergencies, essential for public safety.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-770: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of throttling in operating systems could allow attackers to overwhelm emergency response systems, delaying critical actions.
Unrestricted resource consumption in infrastructure OS could be exploited to disrupt emergency services during crises.
Improperly initialized communication channels could fail during emergencies, disrupting response efforts.
Failure to validate certificates could allow spoofing, impairing emergency communication.
Inadequate logging could delay detection of disruptions, hindering emergency response mitigation.
Failure to log critical events could obscure interference, impairing emergency system recovery.

threat: Unauthorized Access to Government Information Systems
threat_description: Threat actors may exploit access control weaknesses, stolen credentials, or exposed interfaces to access restricted government systems. This includes systems handling classified data, financial operations, and citizen records, risking confidentiality, integrity, and national security.

motives.motive: Steal sensitive data for espionage or sale

components.name: Classified Information Systems
components.description: Systems storing sensitive government data restricted to authorized personnel, critical for national security.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of authentication could allow attackers to access classified data for espionage or illicit sale.
Weak authentication mechanisms could be bypassed, exposing classified information to unauthorized parties.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted classified data could be easily accessed and stolen if systems are breached.

components.name: Financial Systems
components.description: Government systems managing budgets, transactions, and financial records.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inadequate access controls could allow unauthorized access to financial data for theft or manipulation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Misconfigured permissions could enable attackers to access financial systems illicitly.
Hard-coded credentials in financial systems could be exploited to gain unauthorized access.

components.name: Citizen Data Repositories
components.description: Databases containing personal information of citizens, such as Social Security numbers and tax records.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection vulnerabilities in database technologies could allow unauthorized access to citizen data.
Poorly protected database credentials could be compromised, exposing citizen data for theft.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Storing citizen data in cleartext could allow immediate access upon system breach.

components.name: Military Systems
components.description: Systems containing operational plans, troop movements, and defense strategies.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Hard-coded credentials on backend servers could be exploited to access military data.
Lack of authorization checks on servers could allow unauthorized access to military systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted transmission could allow interception of military data during access attempts.

components.name: Law Enforcement Databases
components.description: Repositories of criminal records, investigations, and law enforcement intelligence.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Poor privilege management in the OS could allow escalation to access law enforcement data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Misconfigured OS permissions could enable unauthorized access to databases.
Inadequate logging could prevent detection of unauthorized access to law enforcement data.

components.name: Healthcare Systems
components.description: Government-managed systems storing citizen health records and medical program data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: XSS vulnerabilities in frontend technologies could allow attackers to steal credentials for healthcare system access.
CSRF vulnerabilities could enable unauthorized actions within healthcare systems.
Failure to validate certificates could allow interception of health data during transmission.

components.name: Transportation Systems
components.description: Systems controlling public transit, traffic management, and logistics infrastructure.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Weak authentication in backend technologies could allow unauthorized access to transportation controls.
Hard-coded credentials could be exploited to gain access to transportation systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unverified code updates could introduce vulnerabilities allowing unauthorized access.

components.name: Energy Grid Systems
components.description: Systems managing power generation, distribution, and grid operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-552: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposed file servers could allow unauthorized access to energy grid data or controls.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Misconfigured permissions on file servers could enable access to grid systems.
Weak encryption could allow attackers to bypass protections and access grid data.

components.name: Water Supply Systems
components.description: Systems controlling water distribution, treatment, and quality monitoring.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inadequate input validation could allow attackers to exploit systems and gain unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Bypassing authorization via manipulated keys could allow access to water supply controls.
Failure to log critical events could hide unauthorized access attempts to water systems.

threat_description: Adversaries may seek to alter, overwrite, or falsify data stored in government databases and public record systems by exploiting access control flaws, software vulnerabilities, or insider privileges. This threat targets the integrity of critical government data, including tax records, legal documents, and administrative logs, and may enable fraudulent activities, influence political outcomes, or undermine public trust in official systems.

motives.motive: Alter data for fraudulent or political advantage

components.name: Government Databases
components.description: Repositories containing a wide range of government data, such as tax records, census information, and administrative details, critical to operational and policy functions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection vulnerabilities could allow attackers to manipulate government database records for fraudulent purposes.
Hard-coded credentials in database technologies could be exploited to alter data undetected.
Inadequate access controls could allow unauthorized users to manipulate government data for personal or political gain.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Bypassing authorization could enable attackers to alter database entries illicitly.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Failure to verify data authenticity could allow tampered data to be accepted, compromising government records.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unverified code updates could introduce mechanisms to manipulate government database data.

components.name: Public Records Systems
components.description: Systems managing publicly accessible records, such as property deeds, birth certificates, and court documents, essential for legal and civic functions.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inadequate input validation could allow attackers to submit falsified data, altering public records for fraudulent advantage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-602: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Relying on client-side validation could enable bypassing of server-side checks, facilitating record manipulation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: XSS vulnerabilities could allow attackers to manipulate frontend interfaces, altering displayed or submitted public records.
CSRF vulnerabilities could enable unauthorized changes to public records via forged requests.
Inadequate logging could prevent detection of unauthorized data manipulation in public records.
Failure to log critical changes could allow manipulated records to go unnoticed.

threat_description: Adversaries may seek to extract sensitive information from government systems through unauthorized access, surveillance, or manipulation of data flows. This threat targets confidentiality and operational secrecy by exploiting weaknesses in authentication, access control, encryption, or monitoring mechanisms. It may involve external attackers infiltrating communication channels or insiders accessing sensitive data without detection, enabling long-term intelligence gathering or exposure of classified information.

components.name: Official Communication Systems
components.description: Systems used for internal government communications, including emails, memos, and secure messaging platforms critical to administrative functions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of authentication could allow attackers to access official communications for espionage purposes.
Weak authentication mechanisms could be bypassed, exposing government communications to unauthorized parties.
Hard-coded credentials in backend technologies could be exploited to intercept official communications.
Poorly protected credentials could be stolen, granting access to sensitive government correspondence.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted transmission could allow interception of official communications for intelligence gathering.
Failure to validate certificates could enable man-in-the-middle attacks, compromising communication security.

components.name: Citizen Surveillance Systems
components.description: Systems designed to monitor citizen activities, such as CCTV networks, traffic cameras, and data collection platforms, used for security and law enforcement.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-552: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposed file servers could allow attackers to access surveillance data for espionage purposes.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Misconfigured permissions on file servers could enable unauthorized access to citizen surveillance records.
Inadequate validation could allow attackers to inject malicious data, gaining access to surveillance systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection could enable extraction of surveillance data from underlying databases for espionage.
Weak encryption of surveillance feeds could be decrypted, exposing citizen data to espionage.
Lack of authorization checks could allow unauthorized access to surveillance systems for intelligence purposes.

components.name: Diplomatic Communication Systems
components.description: Secure systems used for diplomatic correspondence, negotiations, and international relations, critical to national security and foreign policy.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inadequate access controls could allow unauthorized access to diplomatic communications for espionage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Bypassing authorization could enable attackers to access sensitive diplomatic data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unverified code in hosted frontend systems could introduce backdoors, allowing espionage of diplomatic communications.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorporating untrusted code in frontend hosting could compromise diplomatic system security.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of outdated encryption could allow decryption of diplomatic communications for intelligence gathering.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of encryption could expose diplomatic data to unauthorized access during transmission or storage.

threat: Exploitation of Government Systems for Political Advantage
threat_description: Threat actors—whether internal or external—may exploit access to government administrative platforms, identity systems, or resource allocation mechanisms to redirect funds, falsify identities, or manipulate official processes for personal, financial, or political benefit. This threat targets the integrity and accountability of government systems and often stems from weak privilege enforcement, insufficient audit controls, or inadequate input validation. It may involve unauthorized transactions, fraudulent system use, or systemic abuse by trusted insiders.

motives.motive: Misappropriate resources or identities for personal gain

components.name: Government Administrative Systems
components.description: Systems managing government operations, employee records, and administrative processes, vulnerable to corruption and insider theft.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inadequate access controls could allow insiders or attackers to misuse administrative systems for corrupt purposes.
Poor privilege management could enable unauthorized users to steal resources or manipulate administrative data.
Hard-coded credentials on backend servers could be exploited to access and misuse administrative systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Misconfigured server permissions could allow theft of administrative data or resources.
Inadequate logging could prevent detection of corrupt activities within administrative systems.
Failure to log critical events could hide theft or misuse of administrative resources.

components.name: Identity Management Systems
components.description: Systems responsible for issuing, managing, and verifying government-issued identities, such as passports, driver’s licenses, and Social Security numbers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection could allow attackers to steal or alter identity records for fraudulent use.
Poorly protected database credentials could be compromised, enabling theft of government-issued identities.
Inadequate validation could allow falsified identity data to be entered, facilitating theft or corruption.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-602: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Relying on client-side validation could enable bypassing of server-side checks, leading to identity theft.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Failure to verify identity data authenticity could allow corrupt alterations for illicit gain.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Storing identity data in cleartext could enable easy theft if systems are breached.

components.name: Resource Allocation Systems
components.description: Systems managing the distribution of government resources, such as budgets, supplies, and contracts, susceptible to theft or corrupt redirection.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of authentication could allow attackers to access and misappropriate resources for personal gain.
Weak authentication could be bypassed, enabling unauthorized redirection of government resources.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: XSS vulnerabilities could allow attackers to manipulate resource allocation interfaces for theft.
CSRF vulnerabilities could enable unauthorized resource allocation changes via forged requests.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted transmission of allocation data could be intercepted, facilitating resource theft.
Logic flaws could be exploited to redirect resources to unauthorized recipients.
